concise_definition: v. 推, 推动, 勉强推进; n. 推, 推动, 努力

definitions.explanation_en: To apply force to an object in order to move it away from oneself, typically with the hands or body.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手或身体对物体施加力量，使其远离自己。
definitions.example_en: He pushed the door open and stepped inside.

definitions.explanation_en: To urge or pressure someone to do something, often persistently or forcefully, especially to achieve a goal or meet a deadline.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指持续或强烈地敦促某人做某事，通常是为了达成目标或满足截止日期。
definitions.example_en: The manager pushed the team to finish the project before the holiday.
definitions.example_cn: 经理敦促团队在假期前完成项目。

definitions.explanation_en: To promote or advocate for something aggressively, such as a product, idea, or political agenda.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指积极地推广或倡导某事物，如产品、理念或政治议程。
definitions.example_en: The company is pushing its new line of eco-friendly products.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司正在大力推广其新的环保产品系列。

definitions.explanation_en: A forceful effort or attempt to achieve a goal, often in the face of resistance or difficulty.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为达成目标而做出的有力尝试，常在面临阻力或困难时进行。
definitions.example_en: The final push before the election brought out record voter turnout.
definitions.example_cn: 选举前的最后冲刺带来了创纪录的投票率。

definitions.explanation_en: A physical act of pressing or shoving something, often with the hand or body.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手或身体进行的推压或推搡动作。
definitions.example_en: She gave the cart a gentle push to get it moving.
definitions.example_cn: 她轻轻推了一下手推车，让它动起来。

comparison.analysis: “Shove” (猛推) 比 “push” 更强调突然、粗暴或用力的动作，常带有不礼貌或强制的意味。例如，推搡人群。而 “push” 更中性，可轻可重，适用于日常或正式语境。
“Encourage” (鼓励) 指通过支持、激励或正面引导促使某人行动，语气温和、积极。而 “push” 常带有施压、强迫或紧迫感，可能引起反感。例如，鼓励孩子学习 vs. 推孩子赶作业。
“Propel” (推动) 是更正式或技术性的词汇，常用于描述由某种动力或力量驱动的运动，如火箭推进、水流推动船只。它强调外力的持续作用，而 “push” 更多指直接的、接触性的物理动作。
